com.revature.testing

Class BatchConstraintTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.testing.BatchConstraintTest

  • public class BatchConstraintTest
extends java.lang.Object
    the BatchConstraintTest program checks that the validators on the Batch bean function as expected
    Author:
    jesuschavez

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BatchConstraintTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void BatchIsNull()
      This is the BatchIsNull method that checks that the amount of null constraints is equivalent to 7 plus the one custom constraint IsValidInterval (which checks that a endDate is not before startDate, however it also returns a violation if one the dates or both are null )
      void classSizeMaximumTest()
      This is the classSizeMaximumTest method test that the constraint that checks that class size does not exceed 35 works
      void classSizeMinimumTest()
      This is the classSizeMinimumTest method which tests to see if a class size is below 5 (under the allowed minimum) and if the contraint to avoid this happening works.
      void curriculumMinimumTest()
      This is the curriculumMinimumTest method which tests that the curriculum id cannot be 0 or a negative number //Added by ERIC and ADAM but putting the @MIN annotation in the batch.java for curriculum
      void isValidIntervalTest()
      This is the isValidIntervalTest method that IsValidInterval constraint is working fine.
      void locationMinimumTest()
      This is the locationMinimumTest method which tests that the location id cannot be a negative number can still be 0 added by Adam and Eric
      static void setUp() 
      void stringNameSizeMinimum()
      This is the stringNameSizeMinimum method that tests that the constraint that test to see if a string is "" works
      void trainerMinimumTest()
      This is the trainerMinimumTest method which tests that the trainer id cannot be 0 or a negative number //Added by ERIC and ADAM but putting the @MIN annotation in the batch.java for trainerid

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void BatchIsNull()
        This is the BatchIsNull method that checks that the amount of null constraints is equivalent to 7 plus the one custom constraint IsValidInterval (which checks that a endDate is not before startDate, however it also returns a violation if one the dates or both are null )

      • isValidIntervalTest

        public void isValidIntervalTest()
        This is the isValidIntervalTest method that IsValidInterval constraint is working fine. It checks that endDate is not earlier than startDate
